title: How to Charge a FitPro Smart Watch

steps.title: Remove the top strap from the watchface.
steps.content: Remove the top strap from the watchface. This is the watch band that's on the opposite side of the circular button that's on the watchface. [1] X Research source It should reveal an extruding piece with two gold pins.

steps.title: Insert the two gold pins into a USB port.
steps.content: Insert the two gold pins into a USB port. The most common charging tool is a USB adapter, like the one that comes with most modern Android phones and tablets. [2] X Research source The display should light up to indicate that it has been plugged in.

steps.title: Connect the USB adapter to a power source (if you're not using a laptop/computer USB port).
steps.content: Connect the USB adapter to a power source (if you're not using a laptop/computer USB port). The USB adapter shouldn't have power running through it if it isn't connected, so plug it in to a wall port. Only plugged in to a charging USB port will the watch display either a charging battery icon. If it's not, remove the watch from the USB port and try inserting it the other direction. [3] X Research source A completely dead FitPro watch should take about an hour to charge. [4] X Research source
